timeline.message:
Use SimpleThreadPool for importtable file renames

Fixes #1464 - importtable improved with parallel calls to fs.rename
from multiple threads within a SimpleThreadPool. Thread pool size is
controlled by new property master.importtable.rename.threadpool.size

Use SimpleThreadPool for importtable file renames

Fixes #1464 - importtable improved with parallel calls to fs.rename
from multiple threads within a SimpleThreadPool. Thread pool size is
controlled by new property master.importtable.rename.threadpool.size

timeline.body: I wonder if we can combine this with ```MASTER_BULK_RENAME_THREADS``` and just have one common value for renames in the Master.
timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we can combine this with MASTER_BULK_RENAME_THREADS and just have one common value for renames in the Master.
timeline.bodyHTML: I wonder if we can combine this with MASTER_BULK_RENAME_THREADS and just have one common value for renames in the Master.
timeline.author: milleruntime
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -251,6 +251,9 @@
   MASTER_BULK_RENAME_THREADS("master.bulk.rename.threadpool.size", "20", PropertyType.COUNT,
       "The number of threads to use when moving user files to bulk ingest "
           + "directories under accumulo control"),
+  MASTER_IMPORTTABLE_RENAME_THREADS("master.importtable.rename.threadpool.size", "20",
+      PropertyType.COUNT,
+      "The number of threads to use when renaming user files when importing a table."),

replies.bodyText: Could deprecate the bulk.rename prop and have a new master.import.rename.threadpool.size.   Could use the AccumuloConfiguration.resolve() method in the bulk import code to get the correct property.
replies.author: keith-turner

replies.bodyText: I was thinking deprecate master.bulk.rename.threadpool.size and create something more generic like master.rename.threadpool.size that could be used anywhere in the Master where we want to optimize renames.  Just doing a quick search for "fs.rename" the new and old Bulk imports could use this property as well.  My point is I don't think it need to have a property for each fate operation.  If a user is having issues with NN renames, they would benefit in the other operations as well.
replies.author: milleruntime

replies.bodyText: Thank you Mike and Keith - I'll lean on your experience to guide me accordingly. I conceptually agree having one property would be better.
replies.author: arvindshmicrosoft

replies.bodyText:
Can I proceed to revise this PR with the following:

deprecate master.bulk.rename.threadpool.size and recommend master.rename.threadpool.size as the new property
update the importdirectory (bulk) code with the appropriate code to resolve the new property and warn about deprecation
update the changed importtable code to leverage the new property

Please let me know.
replies.author: arvindshmicrosoft

replies.bodyText: Sounds good.  After you finish this PR, I can create a follow on ticket to utilize the new property across the other FATE operations that perform renames.
replies.author: milleruntime

replies.bodyText: The changes are implemented. Please take a look. I was also curious about what you meant by "other FATE operations that perform renames". I think bulk ingest (importdirectory) is one, which is addressed in this PR now, but would like to know where else (of course, I'll leave those changes to a later change as you suggested).
replies.author: arvindshmicrosoft

timeline.message:
Usee common property for file rename threadpools

* deprecates master.bulk.rename.threadpool.size
* master.rename.threadpool.size is a new common property shared across
  import and bulk ingest
* update importdirectory (bulk ingest) code to leverage new property

timeline.author: keith-turner

           + "directories under accumulo control"),

timeline.body:
Some of the deprecated properties have the following in their description.  I think this is nice for the generated documentation.

```suggestion
      "This property is deprecated since 2.1.0. The number of threads to use when moving user files to bulk ingest "
```
timeline.bodyText:

+          + " causes the TabletServer to exit.",
+      "1.7.1"),
+  TSERV_WAL_TOLERATED_WAIT_INCREMENT("tserver.wal.tolerated.wait.increment", "1000ms",
+      PropertyType.TIMEDURATION,
+      "The amount of time to wait between failures to create or write a write-ahead log.", "2.1.0"),
+  @Deprecated(since = "2.1.0")
+  @ReplacedBy(property = Property.TSERV_WAL_TOLERATED_WAIT_INCREMENT)
   TSERV_WALOG_TOLERATED_WAIT_INCREMENT("tserver.walog.tolerated.wait.increment", "1000ms",
       PropertyType.TIMEDURATION,
-      "The amount of time to wait between failures to create or write a write-ahead log."),
+      "The amount of time to wait between failures to create or write a write-ahead log.", "1.7.1"),
+  // Never wait longer than 5 mins for a retry
+  TSERV_WAL_TOLERATED_MAXIMUM_WAIT_DURATION("tserver.wal.maximum.wait.duration", "5m",
+      PropertyType.TIMEDURATION,
+      "The maximum amount of time to wait after a failure to create or write a write-ahead log.",
+      "2.1.0"),
   // Never wait longer than 5 mins for a retry
+  @Deprecated(since = "2.1.0")
+  @ReplacedBy(property = Property.TSERV_WAL_TOLERATED_MAXIMUM_WAIT_DURATION)
   TSERV_WALOG_TOLERATED_MAXIMUM_WAIT_DURATION("tserver.walog.maximum.wait.duration", "5m",
       PropertyType.TIMEDURATION,
-      "The maximum amount of time to wait after a failure to create or write a write-ahead log."),
+      "The maximum amount of time to wait after a failure to create or write a write-ahead log.",
+      "1.7.1"),
   TSERV_SCAN_MAX_OPENFILES("tserver.scan.files.open.max", "100", PropertyType.COUNT,
-      "Maximum total RFiles that all tablets in a tablet server can open for scans. "),
+      "Maximum total RFiles that all tablets in a tablet server can open for scans. ", "1.4.0"),
   TSERV_MAX_IDLE("tserver.files.open.idle", "1m", PropertyType.TIMEDURATION,
       "Tablet servers leave previously used RFiles open for future queries."
           + " This setting determines how much time an unused RFile should be kept open"
-          + " until it is closed."),
+          + " until it is closed.",
+      "1.3.5"),
   TSERV_NATIVEMAP_ENABLED("tserver.memory.maps.native.enabled", "true", PropertyType.BOOLEAN,
       "An in-memory data store for accumulo implemented in c++ that increases"
-          + " the amount of data accumulo can hold in memory and avoids Java GC" + " pauses."),
+          + " the amount of data accumulo can hold in memory and avoids Java GC" + " pauses.",
+      "1.3.5"),
   TSERV_MAXMEM("tserver.memory.maps.max", "33%", PropertyType.MEMORY,
       "Maximum amount of memory that can be used to buffer data written to a"
           + " tablet server. There are two other properties that can effectively limit"
           + " memory usage table.compaction.minor.logs.threshold and"
-          + " tserver.walog.max.size. Ensure that table.compaction.minor.logs.threshold"
-          + " * tserver.walog.max.size >= this property."),
+          + " tserver.wal.max.size. Ensure that table.compaction.minor.logs.threshold"
+          + " * tserver.wal.max.size >= this property.",
+      "1.3.5"),
   TSERV_SESSION_MAXIDLE("tserver.session.idle.max", "1m", PropertyType.TIMEDURATION,
       "When a tablet server's SimpleTimer thread triggers to check idle"
           + " sessions, this configurable option will be used to evaluate scan sessions"
-          + " to determine if they can be closed due to inactivity"),
+          + " to determine if they can be closed due to inactivity",
+      "1.3.5"),
   TSERV_UPDATE_SESSION_MAXIDLE("tserver.session.update.idle.max", "1m", PropertyType.TIMEDURATION,
       "When a tablet server's SimpleTimer thread triggers to check idle"
           + " sessions, this configurable option will be used to evaluate update"
-          + " sessions to determine if they can be closed due to inactivity"),
+          + " sessions to determine if they can be closed due to inactivity",
+      "1.6.5"),
   TSERV_SCAN_EXECUTORS_PREFIX("tserver.scan.executors.", null, PropertyType.PREFIX,
       "Prefix for defining executors to service scans. See "
           + "[scan executors]({% durl administration/scan-executors %}) for an overview of why and"

commits_in_main.message: Create max tablets property in new bulk import (#1614)
Fixes #564 adds support multiple compaction executors (#1605)
Fix #1608 move rate limiting to compaction services

fixes #1621: The ClientPool thread pool allows all core threads to time out   * Added properties to allow overridding the allowCoreThreadTimeout in     various threadpools: master incoming requests, tserver incoming requests, master bulk imports
re #1621: Changed the default to "false" for the ...ALLOW_TIMEOUT properties
re #1621: Changed the mechanism to supply a timeout property instead of allow_timeout boolean
Update deprecations with since version information
Make gc candidate batch size configurable (#1706)
Use SI prefix cases in properties (#1708)
Deprecation of VFS Class Loader items, new Context class loader management (#1715)
Fix warnings leftover from VFS deprecation (#1804)
Update SystemCredentials to use crypt(3) format
fixes #1900 Moves volume choosers to SPI (#1905)
Mark external compaction props as experimental (#2129)
Fix external compaction properties names and keys (#2143)
Document some cache props as requiring restart (#2164)
Change WALOG Property Names to WAL (#2171)
Refactor common table property validation to reduce duplication (#2186)
Add new property to configure rfile sorted recovery (#2236)
Rename LogSorter properties to be consistent (#2237)
Fixes #2199 allow system compaction to preempt queued user compactions (#2265)
Add support for LZ4 and BZip2 Codecs (#2367)
Add trace and debug log to consistency check (#2583)
Rename new property for better sorting (#2604)
Trivial: Use https in more places (#2774)
Mark ScanInterpreter related API as deprecated (#2787) (#2806)
Mark FileSystemMonitor as deprecated and slated for 3.0 removal (#2909)
Per table crypto + other crypto improvements (#2197)
Update javadoc tag style to match google style guide (#3064)
Allow user to enable FSDataOutputStream.setDropBehind on majc output (#3083)
Added TABLE_MINC_OUTPUT_DROP_CACHE to drop cache for minc (#3123)
Add a last location mode property (#3142)
Added logic to validate property value against their types (#3177)
Enable users to provide per-volume Hadoop Filesystem overrides (#3180)
Rename GarbageCollectionLogger, optionally pause scans/compactions until memory usage is lower (#3161)

timeline.message: Remove unused property and add deprecation note
